definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]

sentences.english: The soldiers were punished for their base conduct in running away from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵由于临阵脱逃的可耻行为受到惩罚。

sentences.english: Freddy chickened out of the plan at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷迪临阵脱逃，最终退出了这个计划。

sentences.english: He let the opportunity slip and fled the field.
sentences.chinese: 他错过了机会，而且临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: He was accused of running away when the enemy attacked.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控在敌人进攻时临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: Another was escaping from a locked tank that was filled with water.
sentences.chinese: 另一项则是从装满水的上锁水缸中脱逃。

sentences.english: Only a coward perched to escape.
Put him in a designed crisis to see if he will escape or change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 设计一个危机的状况，看他会不会临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: Henry wanted to ask Sue on a date, but then he chickened out.
sentences.chinese: 亨利想约苏出去，但是他后来却临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: Several white-livered fellows ran away at the beginning of the battle.
sentences.chinese: 战斗一开始，几个胆小鬼就临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: The horse broke free from its stable.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马从马厩里脱逃而出。

sentences.english: He knew that once he had caught the sly fox he need not worry about him escaping.
sentences.chinese: 他知道已经收服了的老狐狸不怕他再脱逃。

sentences.english: Other immobilizing effects might let you make escape attempts.
sentences.chinese: 其他定身效应也可能让你可以尝试脱逃。

sentences.english: He goes on to explain that after Bauer was apprehended he escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他继续汇报说，鲍尔在被逮捕后，设法脱逃了。

sentences.english: What do you wish?Tobe known as a shirk.
sentences.chinese: 你希望成为怎样的人？是被认为临阵脱逃者。

sentences.english: Twice when Purvis had Dillinger surrounded he escaped.
sentences.chinese: 普维斯曾两次将迪林格包围，但他都成功脱逃。

definition: to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to pursue/to be after/to hunt down
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to break into jail/to forcibly release prisoners
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
